perturbation.original_text:
“Applicable Law” shall mean all applicable laws, statutes, directives, codes, ordinances, rules, regulations, municipal by-laws, judicial,
arbitral, administrative, ministerial, departmental or regulatory judgments, orders, decisions, ruling or award, consent orders, consent decrees and
policies of any Governmental Authority.
perturbation.changed_text: “Applicable Law” shall mean all mutually agreed upon guidelines, internal policies and best practices of the involved parties and governmental recommendations.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Applicable Law' includes all legally binding rules and regulations. The modified definition replaces this with 'mutually agreed upon guidelines, internal policies and best practices of the involved parties and governmental recommendations', which are not legally binding. This contradicts the standard legal meaning of 'Applicable Law,' making the contract unenforceable as it relates to legal compliance.

perturbation.original_text:
“Force Majeure” as used herein shall mean acts of God; strikes, lockouts, or other industrial
disturbances; conditions arising from a change in governmental laws, orders, rules, or regulations; acts of public enemy; wars; blockades;
insurrections; riots; epidemics; landslides; lightning; earthquakes; fires; storms; floods; washouts; arrests and restraints of governments and
people; civil disturbances; explosions; breakage or accident to machinery or lines of pipe; the necessity for making repairs, tests, alterations, or
performing maintenance to machinery or lines of pipe; scheduled maintenance; freezing of wells or lines of pipe; partial or entire failure of wells,
processing, or gasification and gas manufacturing facilities; orders or directives of, or proceedings initiated by, any Governmental Authority; and
any other causes, whether of the kind herein enumerated or otherwise, not within the control of the Party claiming relief hereunder, and which by
the exercise of due diligence, such Party is unable to prevent or overcome.
perturbation.changed_text: The term “Force Majeure” as used herein shall mean only equipment malfunctions directly attributable to manufacturer error.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes a broad range of events considered 'Force Majeure'. The modified definition severely restricts this to only 'equipment malfunctions directly attributable to manufacturer error.' This contradicts the typical understanding and legal interpretation of Force Majeure, potentially rendering the clause unenforceable under unforeseen circumstances typically covered by such clauses.

perturbation.original_text:
“Services” shall mean receipt and transportation on the System of Product for Shipper’s account from the Receipt Points and delivery to the
Destination Point specified in Shipper’s Nomination.
perturbation.changed_text:
“Services” shall mean attempts at receipt and transportation on the System of Product for Shipper’s account from the Receipt Points and delivery to the
Destination Point specified in Shipper’s Nomination, conditional on system operator's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition defines 'Services' as receipt and transportation. The modified version changes this to 'attempts at receipt and transportation' and adds a condition of 'system operator's sole discretion.' This introduces uncertainty as to whether the service is guaranteed or discretionary, contradicting the original intent and potentially making it unenforceable.
